intro: Dinteranthus margaretae, commonly known as the Margaretae dinteranthus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pale yellow to orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
